mn131:3.2: For “anticipate” (_paṭikaṅkhe_), compare the positive use of _patikkhaṁ_ at [snp3.11:19.4](). An arahant, in contrast, is said to “await their time” (_kālaṁ kaṅkhati_, [sn2.29:15.4]()).
mn131:3.5: The two verses run on here, as indicated by the _ca_ linking this line with the previous.
mn131:3.7: At [thag14.1:5.1](), this phrase refers to the mind developed in meditation on love and compassion, while at [snp5.19:19.1]() it refers to Nibbana.
mn131:4.2: _Samanvāneti_ is unique in early Pali, but the similar _samānayi_ is found at [dn30:1.33.4]() and [thig12.1:10.2]() in the sense of “reunite, bring together”. “Muster” means both to bring together and to arouse.
